name: Roman Basilica
description: The ruins of a Roman basilica, which was converted into a mosque after the 7th century. This site reflects the architectural transitions from the Roman to the Islamic period.

name: Roman Temple Foundations
description: The foundational remains of a Roman temple, offering insights into the religious practices and architectural styles of the ancient city of Sufes.

name: Byzantine Fort
description: Constructed by Solomon, the praetorian prefect of Africa under Justinian I, this fort was built upon a former Roman fortification. Today, only one wall remains, but it signifies the strategic importance of Sufes during the Byzantine era.

name: Town Wall Remnants
description: Fragments of the ancient town wall that once encircled Sufes, indicating the city's historical defenses and urban planning.

name: Nymphaeum Ruins
description: Remnants of a large semicircular nymphaeum, which was decorated with columns and statues. The structure was supplied with water from Wadi Sbiba through a 9 km aqueduct.
